text: [Applause]
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hi i'm kevin from AWS today we're gonna
cover creating and configuring rooms in
alexa for business alexa for business
lets you use alexa to voice enable your
workplace by providing the tools you
need to manage alexa devices skills and
users at scale and an api to the custom
context-aware voice skills for your
organization today we'll go over
creating rooms for our AWS HQ to do this
well first create a room profile then
we'll create a few skill groups each
containing some skills
lastly we'll assign one of our echo
devices that we were previously
provisioned Alexa for business makes it
easy to manage thousands of echo devices
one of the ways that Alexa for business
simplifies this task is the construct of
rooms a room corresponds to the physical
space where you intend to plug in a
shared device for your employees to
interact with it's a container for all
the settings and skills that you wish to
be enabled on all of the devices in the
room a room profile is a collection of
device settings such as address Wake
word and metric versus imperial units
since many of your rooms will share this
information a profile makes it easy to
apply this template of settings to many
similar devices typically customers will
have one room profile per building a
skill group is a collection of skills
before we create our first room let's
first create a room profile to do this
click on room profiles create room
profile and give that profile a
descriptive name enter the address and
time zone in device settings you can
choose the Wake work between the four
supported words Alexa Amazon computer
and echo but we'll leave it as Alexa for
now we'll leave our temperature units
and distance units the same and we'll
leave our maximum volume at ten maximum
volume is useful for smaller rooms
particularly hotel rooms and is only
applicable for echo and echo plus
devices not for echo dot you can select
values between six and ten and scale
down the volume output of the echo
devices in rooms with
this profile typically devices can be
put into setup mode by holding down the
action button on the device for eight
seconds since we're provisioning the
devices for our end users and they
shouldn't have to worry about this we'll
go ahead and set this to off so none of
them can provision this to their own
account
we have another video diving into Collin
so for now we'll leave the outbound
calling section untouched to finish just
click create and now we have a room
profile since we're gonna be creating a
bunch of rooms with this room profile
we'll want to go ahead and set this as
our default to do so just check the room
profile and choose set as default before
we create hundreds of rooms for our AWS
HQ let's first create the skill groups
that will save us time and help us
future-proof our deployment making it
really simple to add a new scale to all
the right rooms a skill group is a
container for skills when a skill group
is added to a room all of the skills in
the group will be added to the devices
in that room when the skill is out into
a group all the rooms that have that
group will automatically get the new
skill there's another video later in the
series that will deep dive on skills to
best practice to ensure you have skill
groups even if they are empty for every
type of room you have in your
organization as well as one for all your
rooms here at AWS HQ will want a skill
group for all rooms video conferencing
rooms non video conferencing rooms and
phone booths this will make it really
easy for us to add skills to sets of
rooms with this level of granularity in
the future to create a group select
skill groups create skill group and give
the skill group a descriptive name click
create and let's create a few more skill
groups now that we have devices
provisioned skill groups and room
profiles created we're all set to start
creating our rooms to create a room
click on rooms create room and enter a
unique name it's important to ensure
that a name is unique and meaningful if
you intend to use a skill that calls the
resolve room API we have another session
in this series that dives deeper into
skills let's follow the convention of
AWS HQ underscore room underscore room
number this way a skill can parse out
which room a request comes from and take
the appropriate action our default
profile is already assigned but we could
choose any of the available profiles
here the room calendar field is used so
that Alexa knows which meeting to join
but we'll leave it blank for now since
there's another video in this series
covering conferencing let's click Next
and then choose the appropriate device
that we'd like to assign to this room
click Next again and select all the
skill groups that are relevant for this
room will select all rooms and non VC
rooms
finally click create room and we're all
set our room was successfully created in
this video we learned how to create room
profiles skill groups and rooms watch
the next videos in this series to learn
how to add skills configure conference
in and invite users to join your
organization thanks for watching
[Music]
